page_content:
GRP XS ELS - Create Group

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The purpose of Group Graphing is to configure instruments under different instrument types together. You can configure graph plots by grouping different instruments. In this manual, you can find instructions on how to setup a group graph under the group type called GRP_XS_ELS. Here you can access information on how to add and view progress comments to the Construction Job Activity with respect to that Group Type and Graph respectively.

You will also learn how to add a group graph to canvas sheet and view 2 GRP_XS_ELS group graphs as cross section in the Canvas Report. This group type feature is available in only specific portals of MissionOS.

Users can select instruments from Instrument Selection list or from the map.

  1. Select from the required zoombox from the list to show the instruments arrays on the map.
  1. Click Selection Area > Instruments > Selection Area.

 

 

  1. Then select from the shape that appears. (Rectangle shape or Free form)
  2. The cursor pointer turns to + icon.
  3. Make the selection of instruments you need from the map.

 

 

  1. Instrument list in Instrument Selection panel updates based on selection area in the map. In the Instrument Selection panel, you can Ctrl + Select Instruments from different types.
  2. Now, click the Create Group
    This action results in automatic navigation to Instrumentation > Setup > Display Group.

 

 

In the Display Group page, under the Group tab,

  1. Select the following as mandatory items from the dropdown list:
  • Instrument Type as DisplayGroup
  • Group Class as GRP_GRAPH
  1. Select Group Type as GRP_XS_ELS from the dropdown list.

 

Note:

To create the group type, open Data Manager > Object Configuration > Object Definition > Type. Here click Create New Type. As new fields populate, enter the same Group Class as in Display Group page. Also enter other details and click Create. A new group type gets created. This group type now appears in the Group Type dropdown menu in Display Group page.

Refer to the figure below to see how a new group type is created:

 

 

 

  1. Select the following details:
  • Project
  • Contract
  • Site
  • Zone
  • Permission
  • Select Job
  • Scaling factor
  1. If the Display Group selected is under any existing group, you can edit/delete the group if required.
  2. To create a new group, enter the new Group Name.

 

 

  1. Click Create.
    User then auto-navigates to Members tab in Display Group which opens.

 

In Members, on the right-hand side you can view the instruments that were selected for the new group creation. On the left-hand side, other instruments under the same hierarchy are shown.

  1. You can drag the instruments from LHS to RHS, if required.
  1. Next, Construction Member selection. Select D-Wall/Pile from those listed.
  2. If the group of instruments shown in the map has D-Wall, select at least 1 D-Wall member (example with 4 coordinate points) Select from one D-Wall. If the group of instruments shown in the map has individual piles, select at least 2 pile members. For example, with single coordinate point.) To select the 2 piles, use (Ctrl + Select). If there are strut elements installed within the Excavation zone, select them as required.
  3. To indicate that the strut elements are installed, select the checkboxes. You can choose struts based on the needs of the user. Unselect checkboxes to indicate that the struts are not installed/removed, if needed.

 

  1. Click Next. You auto-navigates to the Finish Here, you can find all the entered information listed.
  2. Check the information you entered once again and then click the Save
  3. Confirmation message appears that the Group is created.
  4. Click Okay.

 

To watch the Web User Manual video on How to Use GRP XS ELS Group Graphs (Part 1), simply click on the thumbnail or link below:
